Greece  

The Global Compact Network Hellas was launched on May 28th, 2008 during an event organized by the Hellenic Network for CSR and the UNDP Programme Management Office in Athens. During the event, 50 Greek companies committed to implement the ten Global Compact principles in their operations.

Objectives of the Network are the:

  • promotion of Global Compact and its principles in Greece
  • support of business, academics and organizations that are committed to it and in relation with the continuous implementation of its 10 principles
  • dissemination of the ten principles to the business world
  • attraction of new members
  • creation of opportunities for multistakeholder alliances and collective activities
  • support of the wider UN goals for the millennium through activities and events related to all stakeholders

Governance Structure of the Network   
The Hellenic Network for CSR has undertaken the coordination and the secretarial support of the Global Compact Network Hellas.
For the harmonious operation of the Global Compact Local Network Hellas a 5 member Secretariat has been established, which consists of two members of the Board of the Hellenic Network for CSR, its Manager and two other members who are elected every two years among the other participating members of the Network.
The responsibilities of the Secretariat are:
• The provision of information on general issues related to the participation to Global Compact and the local network
• The planning, organization and communication of events which target at the promotion of the ten principles of the Global Compact to the Greek business society
• The expansion of the Network with the participation of new members
• The assembly of the members etc.
Chairman of the Secretariat is the chairman of the board of the Hellenic Network for CSR.

 
(Last updated 21 August 2009)
